data.title: Fix ObjectCreator assembly resolving on Windows.
data.body:
This fixes an issue that prevented out-of-tree compiled dlls from loading on Windows/.NET.

It appears that the assembly resolution on Windows is lazier than mono, and in this specific case does not try to resolve the Mods.Common dependency until after we have removed our custom assembly resolver.

This then leads to the following exception:
> Could not load file or assembly 'OpenRA.Mods.Common, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.

I don't understand why it fails here but works for our main mod dlls.  The `monodis --assemblyref` references to OpenRA.Game and OpenRA.Mods.Common are the same for both.  In any case, keeping our `ResolveAssembly` override around until we dispose the ObjectCreator seems to fix the issue.

Testcase:
* Check out https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAModTemplate/tree/wip on Windows
* Compile the engine and OpenRA.Mods.Example project
* Run the mod using the `launch-game.cmd` script and watch it die
* Change the submodule reference to point to this PR
* Recompile
* Run the mod using the `launch-game.cmd` script and watch it run

Behaviour under mono should not change.

I guess that this explains why third party mods have always insisted on / resorted to hacks to put their dll projects in the main code tree, but I don't understand why it hasn't been reported or seriously discussed as a legitimate engine bug before now.

Requesting reviews from:
* @RoosterDragon, @chrisforbes: You have the most experience in the technical aspects.
* @GraionDilach, @reaperrr: You have the most experience in how this affects third party mods.

data.title: Spectators can make the game lag by rapidly switching views
data.body:
Hi there,

I found out that spectators can make the game lag by holding either 1 or 2 and thus switching through the views of the players.

data.title: Main screen is very choppy and laggy. Also game play.
data.body:
The main screen is very laggy since the update. 
My computer can run all modern games so that shouldn't be a issue. 
Somebody mentioned the bitmap having done this.
I've also noticed when there's a lot of units in the game i start to have odd lag. 
Its choppy lag just like the main screen. These problems just started after the update. 
I have tried and reinstalled the game.

data.title: Technicians looking all the same
data.body:
I dont know if this is wanted but is looking a bit curious now.
This is a result of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12174

data.title: Take screenshot in dialogs #13184
data.body:
Closes #13184
Closes #9508
Take screenshot works fine ingame or in main menu, doesn't work usually in lobby and all dialogs.
I was thinking if this is needed/worth, but the issue is that:
1. Take screenshot works e.g. in lobby or any tab/dialog until you activate Text field. Then it is not possible to take screenshot without moving to another tab/window and back (clicking another widget like checkbox on the same tab doesn't help). So it works at beginning but then stops to work so obviously looks like/is bug.
2. You can take screenshot from Windows even while in Textbox

This small change enables screenshot also in lobby/dialogs anytime.
Note: it is small code duplication. it could be done only once in Ui.HandleKeyPress with little perf impact.

data.title: Fix "game" chat tab mouseover not working from globalchat login tab.
data.body:
Fixes #10415.
Fixes #13277.

data.title: Screenshot not working in lobby
data.body: Should also work there, and in all menues

data.title: Extreme Lag in Multiplayer
data.body:
If someone has a poor network connection, or is running the game on a toaster. The game lags and becomes unenjoyable, and in some cases unplayable. 

Regardless of the abilities of any users computer. The game shouldn't lag for the other players.

data.title: Add an on/off toggle option for chat as a player/observer/replay-viewer.
data.body: At least for casting, getting all the spectator+team chat messages throughout a replay will likely be pretty distracting. In general, big team games and popular matches often attract a lot of spectators, making the chat activity a bit crowded.

data.title: Fix repair cursor visual feedback target.
data.body: This fixes the repair cursor flashing the repair facility rather than the unit that is clicked on.  The target flashes are there to provide feedback on which unit is clicked, so flashing the wrong actor is bad for polish.

data.title: Remove the bitrot GameMonitor StyleCop check.
Mac OS hot corners and dock enabled in game
data.body:
in last 20170421 is a bug, that hot corners and hinding dock is enabled in fullscreen mode, so moving on the map with mouse is complicated and its better to disable it before starting openra
hot corners settings  is in settings/mision control/hot corners and it should be functional only in system, not in fullscreen apps

data.title: Helis return to nearest base like Planes
data.body:
Heli unification of behaviour with Plane

Closes  #13173

data.title: Multiple Chinooks land on top of eachother
data.body:
Happens in RA mod and probably in CNC mod too. Happens in current stable version. (20170421)
Produce multiple chinook transports and order them move order. When the ground is clear for landing, some of them will land on top of another.

data.title: Remove invalid Background widgets from TD map editor.
data.body: Fixes the endless "Could not find collection 'dialog'" debug.log spam.

data.title: Enhance - unify global chat (with lobby chat)
data.body:
Global chat unified in look with lobby chat, new configurable color of player names in global chat.

Global Chat Before:
![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/25304352/c1c4e5be-2765-11e7-9b6e-5d05beab48a4.png)

Now:
![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/25304345/a91558b4-2765-11e7-881a-8a2ce2de251b.png)

data.title: Add Tiberium Floater to TS
data.body:
While not a particularly important piece of the puzzle, this is technically the last blocker for one or two Firestorm 2-player maps, iirc.

Note: The original `Tentacle` weapon stats (16 damage, 15 range) had little to do with actual in-game behavior, WW must have done some hard-coded special sauce somewhere. I decided to increase nominal damage by a factor of 10, otherwise those critters would be almost harmless to most units.

Also added "random file" support to `AmbientSound`.

data.title: Choice of helipad for reloading
data.body:
Hinds and Longbows seem to reload at the previous helipad they were. Not the closest one. 
On the opposite, Yaks and Migs seem to choose the closest one. 

Is there any reason for this different behaviour ?

data.title: Remove metadata that was only used by the mod chooser.
[WIP] Allow mods to provide additional package loaders.
data.body:
See TODO in OpenRA.Game/ModData.cs - im not quite shure whats the best way to get around this.
If anyone has ideas on how to improve or finish this PR, i would like to read your feedback.

data.title: Weird Compression and Missing Visuals Post-Update
data.body:
I just installed the update and noticed everything became noticeably "scrunched" (for a lack of a better word). On top of that, the windowed resolution seems smaller than it was before as well.
I read that the crispier resolution was a bit of a highlight of the update but, I think I somehow received the opposite of what was intended.

Here's some a before and after screenshot...

Before the update:
![field tunnels](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/25296247/539714fa-26b5-11e7-8c1c-d78fd33a4a16.png)
![field gdi base](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/25296377/fd8ae59a-26b5-11e7-98a0-b6453269e914.png)


After the update:
![post update](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/25296257/5faee128-26b5-11e7-80d5-bb8860fc8bfc.png)
![post update 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/25296322/b1293e4a-26b5-11e7-8d9e-a40bedb5eff7.png)

In the last screenshot, you can see the diagonal lines on the placement tiles are distorted unless you double pixel (in-game).

Here's a shot of the RA background as well:
![post update 5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/25296679/933173b0-26b7-11e7-9f4d-90971096516f.png)
I know it's not the same as a recording but, when it's panning, everything looks like it's vibrating because of how compressed everything looks. This also carries over to fullscreen as well.

Here's a shot of the UI. It looks "unaligned" and stretched:
![post update 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/25296821/399a63ec-26b8-11e7-9508-a8cc7f4b8eba.png)

data.title: Submarines play their Uncloak sound at the start of a map
Fix subs playing the submerging sound at the start of a game
data.body: This may or may not be the right fix, I'm not sure if I correctly understand how things are supposed to work now.

data.title: Scripted aircraft are broken (at least in Intervention)
data.body: They don't leave the map but just go to some random place on the map and start circling.

data.title: Tweaked map Deterring Democracy to fix harvester stall
data.body: Tweaked map Deterring Democracy to prevent harvester stalling to the immediate right of the lower-right green tree.

data.title: Give D2k buildings cell-based HitShapes
data.body:
And make D2k weapons attack the closest occupied cell, like in the original game.

Plumbing would also be used by my MechCommander mod, and possibly some other 3rd-party mods.

data.title: Migrate TS artillery deployment to condition system
data.body: Split from #13041 to reduce the latter's diff.

data.title: Icons for Friendlies in Tunnels & Detected Underground Enemies.

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
This ticket is for the expanded use of the icons (such as the RA GPS icons) rendered where actors should not be rendered themselves:
 * Friendly actors in tunnels (TS)
 * Enemy actors underground but detected (TS)
 * Possibly other use cases by external mods?

This would require a rendering trait using a condition expression and a render player stance check.

Basically @pchote's comment [here in "General tunnel issues"](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12662#issuecomment-276376126).

Plus some style fixes.
Best testcase for potential regressions: RA Flame Turret.

Also, moved legacy map import commands to UtilityCommands subfolder.
